channel.title: 14th Song
channel.description:
Like I said, I'll update you guys. Here's Failing Forward- [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cKrC7vCfSdA[/url]
recommendations, critiques, and helpful comments appreciated. Thanks :slight_smile:

item.title: 14th Song
item.dc:creator: Veritas
item.description:
This is actually pretty good, makes me think of something ‘Digitalism’ would make. Plus you say your 17? You’ve got a long way to go, but I have to say I’m excited to follow, wherever your taking this. Keep it up.

Read full topic

item.title: 14th Song
item.dc:creator: GravityGun
item.description:
Guzzi:

I’m not sure if you create music to apply to an element (video game, movie etc…) or if you create for listening enjoyment, but I hear some good melodies in there for sure.

You have a nice build up to the climax. There are one or two overbearing instruments (Or VST’s) but you did well in cutting them short so I can have a break from it from them until your next build up.

My personal tastes don’t have me listening to this while I’m driving down the road but I can definitely find enjoyment listening to your song while playing a nice side scrolling game similar to Super Meat Boy.

Keep up the good tunes

You can’t go wrong with honesty. I totally agree with you. I favor epic background music you might find in a movie or videogame, with an orchestra/ ambient feel. Like John Williams! He’s my idol and has inspired me greatly as a kid -from Star Wars to Jurassic Park (I’m 17 btw so I guess I’m still considered a kid). I try basing my music more off this orchestra form that enriches an experience, and gives you that chilly feeling. Its hard to explain, but I’m sure you know what I mean

Read full topic
